body_html:
I got the same problem!

I installed tensorflow in a clear conda environment following: https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r0.8/get_started/os_setup.html#anaconda-environment-installation

Then:

$ pip list | grep protobuf
 protobuf (3.0.0b2)

Now, python -c "import tensorflow" works fine.

Then I intsalled the fast C++ based protobuf-3.0.0b2.post2 following: https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/g3doc/get_started/os_setup.md#protobuf-library-related-issues

Then:

$ pip list | grep protobuf
protobuf (3.0.0b2.post2)

However, python -c "import tensorflow" would have Segmentation fault (core dumped).

So, how should I install fast c++ protobuf when installing tensorflow using pip only?

body:
I got the same problem!

I installed tensorflow in a clear conda environment following: https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r0.8/get_started/os_setup.html#anaconda-environment-installation

Then: 

```
$ pip list | grep protobuf
 protobuf (3.0.0b2)
```

Now, `python -c "import tensorflow"` works fine.  

Then I intsalled the fast C++ based  `protobuf-3.0.0b2.post2` following: https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/g3doc/get_started/os_setup.md#protobuf-library-related-issues

Then: 

```
$ pip list | grep protobuf
protobuf (3.0.0b2.post2)
```

However, `python -c "import tensorflow"` would have Segmentation fault (core dumped).

So, how should I install fast c++ protobuf when installing tensorflow using pip only?
